txt.en: You have found a strange rune-marked key within the chest
This is not the chest you seek
You solved the first riddle, which led to a plaque marked with a snake. Further within the room thus marked is a plaque inscribed with a riddle in Falgeirr's hand.

This plaque is inscribed with a riddle in Falgeirr's strange language.

At night, I come without being fetched.
By day, though lost, I am not gone.
All know me, but only the ocean heeds my call.

Solve Twisttongue's riddle by choosing the correct chest:

At night, I come without being fetched.
By day, though lost, I am not gone.
All know me, but only the ocean heeds my call.

'You are a riddle-master as well as a doughty [placeholder], eh, [placeholder]? That is most impressive! Let us see what you found here... a key?\n\n'Interesting! I should hang onto this, if I were you. It might come in handy if you find any more of Twisttongue's riddling in Moria.'
Öndótt can be found in the Old Silvertine City in the Silvertine Lodes.\n\nYou should tell Öndótt that you solved an ancient riddle and uncovered a key.

'At night...what comes without being fetched? I had a cat once who practically never left me alone...but she would come and go according to her own will. I'm not sure she could be fetched, actually. My, this is a true riddle. Comes without being fetched....\n\n'And surely no cat would heed the ocean's call....'
Choose the chest marked with a plaque that solves the riddle
Talk to Öndótt about the key you found
